meanings.definition: Worn to the point of being thin and tattered.
meanings.sent1: The threadbare blanket provided little warmth on the cold night.
meanings.sent2: The threadbare carpet in the hallway needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: The threadbare excuse he gave for being late was that he got lost in his own neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her threadbare patience finally wore thin after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent5: The threadbare book had pages so worn that they crumbled at the touch.
